Commentary: Dinda to Pollard, no run, was that a drop? Need another look. Wide yorker outside off, Pollard bends down to squeeze it out, the ball takes the under-edge and goes low to Dhoni's right. The former skipper goes with one hand and spills it. Tough one for Dhoni and Dinda's unlucky day continues, second drop off his bowling

Nehra to Dwayne Smith, no run, brilliant work from Henriques. A direct-hit would've been interesting. A fuller length delivery on the stumps, Smith pushes it meekly towards extra cover, Moises dives to his right and throws at the non-striker, all in one motion. DK was backing up for a single and had to turn back and dive full-length to make his ground

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, no run, oh nearly.. A communication breakdown between both the batsmen almost resulted in a run-out. A short of length delivery outside off, Karthik slashed it straight to point, Kulkarni set off for a single, DK was ball-watching and sends him back. Yuvi, the fielder, was slow to react and fires a throw at the non-strikers end, misses the target and Kulkarni survives

Rashid Khan to Raina, no run, edged and dropped, that was a chance and Warner at first slip has missed it. It was a tough opportunity though, Raina went with hard hands, the edge was flying and to the right of the captain, he went with hard hands and shells it. Coming to the ball, it was tossed up invitingly outside off, another wrong 'un from Rashid, lured Raina into the mistake - but Raina survives

Nehra to Dwayne Smith, no run, brilliant work from Henriques. A direct-hit would've been interesting. A fuller length delivery on the stumps, Smith pushes it meekly towards extra cover, Moises dives to his right and throws at the non-striker, all in one motion. DK was backing up for a single and had to turn back and dive full-length to make his ground

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, no run, oh nearly.. A communication breakdown between both the batsmen almost resulted in a run-out. A short of length delivery outside off, Karthik slashed it straight to point, Kulkarni set off for a single, DK was ball-watching and sends him back. Yuvi, the fielder, was slow to react and fires a throw at the non-strikers end, misses the target and Kulkarni survives

Rashid Khan to Raina, no run, edged and dropped, that was a chance and Warner at first slip has missed it. It was a tough opportunity though, Raina went with hard hands, the edge was flying and to the right of the captain, he went with hard hands and shells it. Coming to the ball, it was tossed up invitingly outside off, another wrong 'un from Rashid, lured Raina into the mistake - but Raina survives

Kuldeep Yadav to Pollard, no run, uh oh! A bad mix-up there with Pollard being sent back from the middle of the pitch. But he makes it home. The throw isn't a great one from Pathan either. Rana called him initially but then backtracked as Pollard steered it to point. These are nervy times

Sandeep Sharma to Vishnu Vinod, no run, yes-no and the last thing RCB want is for Vinod to run AB out. Thankfully no damage done. He defends this back of a length delivery towards cover-point and blindly sets off, AB rightly sends him back and Stoinis' throw wasn't accurate at the striker's end

Mohit Sharma to Mandeep, no run, another yes-no and Mandeep escapes. A direct-hit would have seen him walk back. He wanted to drive this short of length delivery through cover, got an inside edge to Amla at mid-wicket, AB shouts and sends him back, the throw was wide of the stumps

Zaheer to Dinda, no run, has Karun plucked a one-handed stunner? The third umpire is called for, the soft call is OUT. Looked like a good catch on first view. Has the ball touched the ground, has he got his fingers underneath? The third umpire is having a look at different angles, this will be a tricky call. NOT OUT it is. Fair call, looked like the ball might just have touched the ground as Karun plucked it. Coming to the ball, it was full and shaping away, squared up Dinda as he was looking to work it towards the on-side, the edge flew to the left of first slip. Karun stuck his left hand out and claimed the catch

SN Thakur to Brendon McCullum, no run, hit straight back at Thakur who puts it down. Half a chance here. McCullum had timed that beautifully and the ball was travelling. But it came at a nice height in the followthrough. Thakur parries it towards mid-off

Cariappa to Corey Anderson, no run, almost thumped it back to Cariappa. Flatter offie around, Anderson hangs back and punches it straight down the wicket, did not keep it down the ground, Cariappa is late to react, the ball hits his upper part of his hand and goes to ground. Tough chance but should have been taken

SN Thakur to Kohli, no run, Tiwary drops Kohli. Oh you can't do that. Thakur hits the pitch hard on a back of a length outside off, Kohli dangles a horizontal bat and edges it for a simple catch to first slip where Tiwary makes a meal of it

Narine to Nair, no run, dropped! The penalty you pay for fielding a part-time wicket-keeper. The flatter knuckle ball around off, Nair moved away to the leg-side and tried to force it off the back foot, the outside edge goes straight in and straight out of Uthappa's gloves. That would have been two set batsmen removed in one over
Zaheer to M Pandey, no run, rib-tickler this time, tucked straight to short fine. Wanted a single but wisely sent back by his partner. A direct-hit from Morris would've been close
Nabi to Axar, no run, spills a return catch. Axar hits it straight back at him but it's not coming too fast and the height is pretty comfortable too. He should have taken it

Chris Morris to Dhawan, no run, direct hit and Yuvraj would have had a diamond duck to his name. Very full and on leg-stump, Dhawan misses the flick and is rapped on the pads, the ball rolls to the left of Morris and Yuvraj was backing up for the run. Dhawan sends him back and Morris fires a throw which is off-target

Narine to Raina, no run, dropped! The odds of this happening are high when you field a non-regular keeper. Raina pokes at a turning off-break and gets an outside edge. Uthappa fails to gobble it up. How costly is that going to be?

Stokes to Warner, no run, dropped, it's the Australian captain who has dropped his vice-captain. An Englishman looks aghast. Length delivery outside off, Warner got a big stride forward and drilled it straight to Smith at mid-off, in and out, that was a sitter

Chris Morris to Buttler, no run, dropped by Rishabh Pant! Buttler went too far across his off-stump and tried the scoop, he may have played that stroke a touch too early. Spoons it straight to the keeper who was late to pick the ball as the ball swirled around him to distract his attention. Oh, boy!

Tahir to Karn Sharma, no run, oh Tiwary. He puts down another. This time it goes right in, only to pop out. A fierce slap this from Karn finding extra cover to perfection. Just that the catch cannot stick in his palms tonight

Stokes to Nitish Rana, no run, did that carry to Tiwary? Oh what a big wicket that would have been. Round the wicket, slanting the ball in on a back of length and getting it to straighten a touch. Rana fences it to slip. Oh, this is close. It might have just fallen short. Centimetres
Kuldeep Yadav to Corey Anderson, no run, lucky is Corey Anderson! That was scooped back to the bowler who lets it pop out. Dolly of a catch it was as the batsman pushed it back on the clipped drive
Axar to Warner, no run, dropped! Quicker delivery outside off, Warner cuts it and gets a thick outside edge. Saha couldn't hold onto the catch. Wasn't an easy one either

Aaron to Rabada, no run, chance and dropped. Shaun Marsh is the culprit, he had two bites at the cherry, but can't hold on. Length delivery outside off, Rabada drilled it towards cover, Marsh tumbled to his right and let the ball slip, he was alert though, turned around and tried to grab the rebound, but can't do so. He had it for a moment, but the ball popped out as his elbows hit the ground

Shami to Parthiv Patel, no run, direct hit at the striker's end and Parthiv Patel was gone. But as luck would have it, Cummins missed the target. It was again a short ball and Parthiv Patel went for the pre-meditated hook, could not get behind the shot and ended up deflecting off the face of the bat toward mid-wicket. Was blinded through the motion and did not spot where the ball went. Heard the call late but was back in time

S Kaul to Hardik Pandya, no run, a direct-hit would have been curtains for Rohit. Pandya stands tall and punches it straight to cover. Henriques, there, makes a sharp stop and has a shy at the stumps at the bowler's end. Rohit was nowhere in the frame

Harbhajan to Henriques, no run, put down. Oh Harbhajan. Gets the ball to stick on the surface making Henriques stand back and check his push. Chips it meekly in the end off a straight batted defence, straight to the bowler. Doesn't quite anticipate the sharp dip on this does Bhajji as he barely stoops low. An out-popper

Zaheer to Kohli, no run, just doesn't stick. Zak has to give himself the stare here. Lets off the big man after inducing him into a false stroke. Misreads the slower one here does Kohli and is way early into a whack. Chips it back to the bowler, who in his followthrough gets both palms to it. Just doesn't stick

Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, no run, a review for LBW. Looks high to the naked eye but gee that's hit Shreyas Iyer on the back pad, above the knee roll. Carrom ball I think, which skids on instead of turning away. Beats the batsman for pace and goes through Iyer, who's standing on his back foot to meet that. Ball-tracking is in and it's umpire's call on height, as suspected

Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, no run, a review for LBW. Looks high to the naked eye but gee that's hit Shreyas Iyer on the back pad, above the knee roll. Carrom ball I think, which skids on instead of turning away. Beats the batsman for pace and goes through Iyer, who's standing on his back foot to meet that. Ball-tracking is in and it's umpire's call on height, as suspected

Johnson to de Villiers, no run, appeal for caught behind and he's been given. AB reviews immediately. He checks with the umpire about what the decision was for. The umpire informs him he's given him caught behind. There was a noise as the ball passed the bat, but clearly the ball just touched the flap of the pad and was nowhere close to the bat or glove. It was a short of length delivery outside off stump, de Villiers tried to guide that to third man and missed. DRS saves de Villiers

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, edged and dropped. "One of the safest fielders in the slips has dropped a catch" is the comment from Sanjay Manjrekar on air. Huge moment in the game. Guess who's the culprit? It's skipper Ajinkya Rahane. A simple regulation take - length delivery angled across outside off. Dhawan aiming to break the dots slashes hard and outside-edges it straight to first slip. Jinks gets both hands but shells it. Kulkarni is in disbelief

Narine to Dhoni, no run, Narine is a smart operator and he will mix it up. Important to read him from the hand rather the surface. Dhoni did not pick the off-break and lunged forward to nudge it into the on-side, beaten on the inside edge and struck around the kneeroll. The big press forward helped him there as ball-tracking showed it to be going over

Krunal Pandya to Saha, no run, was that a chance? Saha backed away and Pandya followed him. Got a bit of turn and Saha missed the cut. The keeper failed to catch it cleanly. Not sure if there was any bat involved

Mustafizur to Roy, no run, a hat-trick of dots, you are kidding me! Slower delivery again that spins across, Roy pokes at it and misses. MI review just like that, obviously no edge on that. Gee this is unbelievable stuff

Chawla to Deepak Hooda, no run, now then, there's a review from KKR for leg-before. Hooda didn't pick a googly from Chawla and was hit on the back pad. But in real time, it looked like the impact may have been outside off. Oh wait, there's an inside edge too. So that's that

Nadeem to Nitish Rana, no run, Nadeem is jumping for an lbw appeal. Does not get it and Gambhir takes it. To the naked eye, looked like an under edge. Need UltraEdge to confirm. No bat. So we move on. Impact? Outside the line and that is such a poor review and DD burn their only review. Was very full to be sweeping, Nitish Rana went for it and managed to get himself outside the line

Shami to Karthik, no run, DK has been given out lbw. By umpire Nand Kishore. Looks a dodgy decision. That's why the KKR skipper went for the review straight away. UltraEdge shows a big spike and the crowd cheer. Huge inside edge onto the pads. How did Nand Kishore miss that? Shami was pumped, but all that celebration now turns sour! Was a length delivery cutting back in, raps Karthik above the kneeroll, but there was an edge before that

Woakes to Hardik Pandya, no run, a peach. Oh it doesn't get better. And to imagine it coming in the death in the midst of an onslaught. Oh and amidst all this noise, the umpire's heard a tickle. He's given him caught behind. But Pandya isn't amused, he goes up instantly. Why bother consulting your partner with 10 balls to go in the day. And UltraEdge is a murmur all through, but when it passes the bat it gets a little bigger. The sound's deaf. Oh and forget the spikes, the third umpire overturns

Unadkat to Nitish Rana, no run, slower length ball on off, Rana defends back towards the bowler and sets off for a single. Ridiculous judgement. Karthik obviously sends him back, but even a dive wouldn't have saved him if Unadkat had hit the stumps direct. Michael Clarke calls it the worst attempted single in the history of cricket

Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, no run, good use of the technology by Rahul! He was very sure that he had hit it and UltraEdge confirms the inside edge. He was stuck on the crease to this inswinger and got pinged on the back leg. Cannot fault the umpire for raising his finger because if not for the edge, it was dead plumb

Barinder to Saha, no run, Punjab have gone for a review. My naked eyes tell me this is high and it might be going down the leg side. Saha is jumping in the crease when ball strikes him on the back pad. It is clipping the stumps -- the top of middle and leg -- but just clipping so it is umpire's call and Punjab retain their review. Good inward shape from Barinder on that back of a length ball

Mujeeb to Williamson, no run, Punjab have gone for a review. Williamson is a long way down the ground. Ultra edge shows no edge and DRS shows ball is just hitting the leg stump. Punjab retains the review again. Williamson comes down the track on the ball and misses the bat totally, ball hits his pads

Chahar to Klaasen, no run, dropped! Deja vu! Watto was dropped in the first over at first slip and he does the same now. A beautiful delivery from Chahar. Seam-up delivery on a good-ish length that decks away a tad and Klaasen dangled his bat out. The thick outside edge carries to Watson, but that's been put down. Klaasen survives. The centurion wasn't quite ready - was late to react

Chahar to Rahane, no run. Another appeal for lbw and this time CSK decide to review. Fair delivery. The knuckle ball and Rahane didn't pick it. Was early into the shot and got struck on the back thigh. Was there any bat involved? A light spike on the UltraEdge. An inside edge. CSK lose their only review. It was on a length and Rahane walked forward to work it through the on-side. Didn't pick it, on that occasion did Rahane

Siraj to Pant, no run, Siraj appeals for LBW. But that ball had clearly pitched outside leg. Pant winds up for a big mow by clearing his front leg, was beaten for pace as he missed the heave to the leg-side, pinged on the back thigh where there is no protection. He is down on the ground grimacing in pain. Meanwhile, RCB take the review and waste it. Not sure who prompted them to challenge the decision as it had pitched miles outside leg. Nonetheless, the good thing for DD is Pant is back on his feet and is ready to resume..

Shakib to Rayudu, no run, Saha completed the catch and went up immediately. Shakib joined him as well. Williamson trusting his players challenged the decision, but it remains with the onfield call. Rayudu steps out and is tucked by the drifter, misses the nudge into the on-side and the ball lobs off the pad to the left of Saha. He moves across to catch that

Mustafizur to Stokes, no run, Mustafizur is excited but that looks high. Traps Stokes on the shuffle with this delivery. Oh they've gone for the review. It's hit the knee-roll bang in front of off-stump, so the impact is alright. But as we doubted, the bounce in this Jaipur deck is taking the ball over the stumps -- the ball-tracking confirms. So not out it'll be and Mumbai lose their review

Rajpoot to Gambhir, no run, Ashwin reviews. Makes sure first with the keeper that it was straight enough and then goes for it. Last ball from Rajpoot was the one that shaped away and beat Gambhir, and this straightened and slithered on to rap Gambhir's front pad's flap. But tell you what, this is just a bit naff, this review. Pitches almost a foot outside leg-stump, and it's not out -- just as the on-field umpire thought

Barinder to Shreyas Iyer, no run, the appeal was so loud and confident that the umpire was under a lot of pressure, fair on KXIP's part because they thought it was a genuine edge, but the fact that Shreyas Iyer immediately smiled and reviewed clearly suggested he didn't hit this. Maybe the ump should have originally given the benefit of doubt to the batsman, because the bat also hit the ground. Wide yorker, Shreyas Iyer tried to squeeze, missed it completely and there's no spike on UltraEdge. Review saves Shreyas Iyer

Mishra to Miller, no run, now Prithvi. Oh these catches keep going down -- the simplest of them. Miller is foxed by the wrong 'un, again, as he goes deep in the crease to some-sort-cut. Chipped up, straight to extra cover in the ring. Shaw gets both hands, perhaps closing them a little too early. Debut nerves

Markande to Y Pathan, no run, that is a very ambitious appeal for lbw. Pathan is a huge man and with that big stride of his, always will get his front foot outside the line, this one is the leggie and the impact looks outside off and what's more it is spinning away. Hang on - MI have taken the review. Could well lose it. Replays show that the impact is outside off and that's MI's review gone down the gutter

Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, no run, chance and Tye has dropped a dolly. That should have been four for Rajpoot, short and just outside off, Manish swivelled across and nailed the pull, straight into the hands of Tye at mid-wicket - who somehow clangs a sitter

Boult to Watson, no run, drama that is what kick-starts match number 30. That looked close. The ball nipped in and struck the pads. Bat first is what the third umpire reckoned and Watson survives. That was mighty close. That looked dead but the on-field umpire said it not out and rightly so as there seemed to be a faint inside edge

Bumrah to de Grandhomme, no run, yorker outside off, de Grandhomme fails to get bat on ball. Ishan Kishan fumbles and CdG looks for a quick bye, comically he loses balance and stumbles to get back. Ishan Kishan misses and the Kiwi gets away

Bumrah to de Grandhomme, no run, yorker outside off, de Grandhomme fails to get bat on ball. Ishan Kishan fumbles and CdG looks for a quick bye, comically he loses balance and stumbles to get back. Ishan Kishan misses and the Kiwi gets away

D Kulkarni to Prithvi Shaw, no run, dropped! RR and dropped catches of openers has cost them bad! That was a low full toss and the batsman drove it back. Kulkarni juggled it and the ball popped out like a pop-corn. Did Kulkarni get too excited?

Plunkett to R Tripathi, no run, Tripathi misses the ball again and it strikes him on the pads, DD go for a LBW review. Actually it was a win-win review for DD, or so Iyer thought. Plunkett had taken the return catch, which meant that even an inside edge and Tripathi was out. DRS shows the the ball missed the bat and was going down the leg-side clearly, so DD lose their review too

Boult to D Arcy Short, no run, Short has been given out but he has taken the review instantly. Short is spot on as ball has hit his hip, and not the bat as he swatted into a pull. Umpire will change his decision. It was a short of length delivery, D Arcy Short was beaten by the pace and ball defeats him and goes to the keeper.

Chawla to Raina, no run, was there a nick? There was a certain deviation and also, a faint noise. I guess, the reaction of Chawla suggests that there was an edge. So, will go down as a drop. Guess, who's the culprit? It's the skipper, DK. Googly, turning away from Raina, who went for the drive. Scraps the outside edge, straight in and out of DK's gloves. Costly drop? Surely

KM Asif to Narine, no run, dropped! Can you believe it? CSK's best fielder has put one down. Narine slapped the shortish delivery to mid-off where Jadeja spills it out. He tried to take it on the second attempt too, but failed even then

KM Asif to Narine, no run, second dropped catch! This is unbelievable really. Is this Narine's night? Went hard at a shortish delivery and miscued it to Jadeja at mid-off. He jumped in order to take it but failed yet again. But you know Narine, he'll give you more chances

McClenaghan to Axar, no run, direct-hit and Nair would've been on his way back to the hut. Patel gets an inside edge onto his pad, the ball drops into the off-side. McClenaghan rushes forward, collects the ball and sees Nair stuttering at the middle of the pitch. Picks up and rifles a throw at the non-striker's end, but misses the target

de Grandhomme to Dwayne Bravo, no run, chance and Parthiv has shelled it, it was a tough chance, he was standing up to the batsman, on a good length and well wide of off, Bravo went for the flamboyant drive, got a feather and Parthiv grabbed at that, it popped out and he had a second bite at the cherry, but can't hold on

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, no run, Saha has dropped it! Could have been the second wicket for Rashid. Iyer tried to work that short delivery away to the on side but got a thick inside edge. Saha behind the wickets makes a mess of it as the Delhi skipper gets a life

Hardik Pandya to Uthappa, no run, chance and dropped, that's a dolly and Markande has somehow dropped it. Then slower short ball outside off, Uthappa swivelled across on the pull, doesn't get hold of the shot and hit it straight to mid-on. It came at a very good height, Markande went reverse cupped and somehow let the ball pop out

Prasidh to Hardik Pandya, no run, low full toss and Pandya swings so hard that the bat flies out of his hand, he then tries to steal a bye with the bat lying near square leg and Karthik misses to run him out. He was gone by a mile, in the end they don't even go through with the run

Stokes to Rahul, no run, fuller length delivery and Rahul hits it straight to cover, he wanted a single but Akshdeep Nath wasn't interested at all. And when the fielder picked up the ball Rahul was almost in the mid crease, he had given up but throw was wayward and Rahul gets away with it

Ish Sodhi to Akshdeep Nath, no run, RR have gone up for a lbw review against Nath. The pertinent point is whether it has hit the bat first or pad? No bat involved. It hit the pad first, but the ball straightened enough to miss the off pole. It was a flighted delivery, Nath was prodding forward to tap, but the ball gripped off the pitch to clip him high on the front pad

Unadkat to Dhoni, no run, that was smacked hard by Dhoni. Middled his shot but hit the stumps at the bowler's end. Billings wanted the run but Unadkat was quick to gather the ball and uproot the stumps with the ball in his hand. Billings was out of the crease for while but makes sure to get back in time

Mujeeb to Narine, no run, dropped! That was a tough chance as it was struck hard by Narine. Mujeeb hardly had any time to react there. Got his right hand to it but failed to cling on. He's in some pain, in fact he's going off the field. How costly a blow will that be for Kings XI? He has been one of their best bowlers this season.

Dwayne Bravo to Deepak Hooda, no run, Hooda has been given out LBW, he has a word with his partner and decides to review. Bravo's foot is way behind the line, so no problems with the no-ball. Moving on, looks like no bat as well. Ultra-Edge confirms it. HawkEye in - Pitching - In-line. Impact - In-line. Wickets - missing. Superb review from Hooda. It was full and spearing in, Hooda was shuffling across and misses the clip. Is thudded low on the pad, the on-field call was OUT and Hooda challenged it. Gets the decision in his favour in the end with the ball missing the leg-stump

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, chipped up. And just short of a diving mid-on. Suryakumar's early into his flick, miscues, balloons, but Gowtham just can't dive down in time. Blame his frame. Oh no wait, these dastradly slomos tell us it's into his fingers first before it pops out

Krunal Pandya to Rahane, no run, Krunal has won here. Not with a wicket yet, but with a review. Implored Rohit, convinced him, and the captain yielded. On first sighting, that's going down leg. Arm-ball that Rahane's trying to sweep. Misses and is hit on the front pad. Ball-tracking suggests that the impact is on leg-stump, so with the left-armer's angle from round the wicket, that must be going down. Is actually. Not out. Review wasted.

U Yadav to Gayle, no run, dropped!! Parthiv dives to his left and the ball pops out of his left mitt. That angled away late and the batsman poking at it, got a thick edge. The keeper went for it one-handed only to drop it. His left hand was lower than the actual trajectory of the ball and that meant he was hit higher on the palm, forcing the spill

Sandeep Sharma to Parthiv Patel, no run, dropped first ball! What a beginning that would've been to the game. Straight in and straight out. Deepak Hooda at short cover who got both hands and then it went out. Was a fairly straightforward chance too. Driven in the air and Parthiv Patel gets lucky

Siraj to Hales, no run, dropped by Kohli diving at mid-on. Dove too far actually. Ended up hitting his wrist. Drilled by Hales and the RCB skipper got both hands and spilled it. Isn't happy with himself at all

Mishra to Raina, no run, dropped! Oh, Pant! He would be gutted not to have held onto this one. What a moment it would have been for DD! The slider which goes across Raina with the angle, he pushed with hard hands and got a tiny feather, it went rapidly to the left of Pant and smacked him on the leg. Tough one, but goes down as a chance

Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, no run, Thakur, again. A direct hit would have been curtains for Pant! The run was definitely not on. Iyer slightly backed away and Chahar followed him with a short of length ball, thereby cramping him for room. It was punched towards mid-on. A yes-no situation and Pant put in a desperate dive. Luckily, the fielder failed to hit the target

U Yadav to Klaasen, no run, the review was retained and lucky for Royals as Klaasen survives. Decision has to be over-turned! Excellent delivery by Yadav though. He's on fire today. Bowls a full length delivery tailing into the batsman, almost a yorker and Klaasen manages to get an inside edge as he brings his bat down in time.

A Russell to Goswami, no run, Goswami has been given out caught at slip, he wants a review. It's a fair ball, it's gone off the helmet, but is there some glove before it? I don't think so, there's daylight between gloves and the ball, should get this decision overturned, Goswami. Ultraedge confirms it as well. NOT OUT is the call. That's a good review from Goswami, he knew there wasn't any bat or glove, the bouncer from Russell and Goswami was way too late on the pull, thudded into his helmet and lobbed towards Rana at slip. Umpire Anil Chaudhary was quick to raise his finger, but he has to change his call

Hardik Pandya to Pant, no run, Pant has been given out LBW and he immediately reviews. I think it's pitching well outside leg, a shocker from umpire Nandan and feel this will be overturned. No bat on that and it's confirmed by Ultraedge. Hawk-Eye will confirm my doubt and it has pitched miles outside leg. NOT OUT is the call. Poor decision from umpire Nandan and the crowd cheer as NOT OUT flashes on the screen. Pant was looking to whip a full ball on his pads and missed

Rajpoot to Harbhajan, no run, dropped! Rajpoot almost gets another one. Finch the culprit on this occasion. Squared him up completely with the length delivery and induced an outside edge too. However, Finch at second slip makes a mess of it! This was a straight-forward catch for Gayle. Double wicket-maiden for Rajpoot. Absolute gold!

Rashid Khan to du Plessis, no run, and this call, if upheld, could seal the game. Faf given out LBW to a googly from Rashid. He's gone for the review. This is shady, as the ball seems to be a bit leg-sidish. You can see middle and off stump when it hit the pad. Williamson has already got his fielders in position, so he doesn't seem very confident. Yes, as expected, it's missing leg stump. Faf survives. CSK still alive, if only just

Jadeja to Brathwaite, no run, run-out chance missed. Brathwaite taps the flatter delivery into the on-side and sets off, Pathan is not interested and the big bloke has to turn and run back, Dhoni runs forward, picks the ball and has a shy, misses and Brathwaite survives

Chawla to Rahane, no run, quick skidder. Rahane's done in, struck on his pad. And the umpire gives into Chawla's celebratory LBW appeal. Tripathi doesn't allow him to leave, forces him to review. So Rahane's well deep in the crease, doesn't read the googly, is beaten on pace as well. But he's struck on the front pad. And yes .. the angle is enough to take it down leg.

Narine to R Tripathi, no run, massive inside edge. But DK's desperation in the carnage forces him to go upstairs. So Tripathi's pinned on the back foot. And yes .. it's a big chunk of the wood onto his pad

Shakib to A Russell, no run, is that a drop? Arm-ball, slides back in and probably takes an inside-edge onto pad before popping towards Saha who never gets his gloves in the right place. Shakib with a priceless reaction, collapsing at the bowler's end

Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, no run, interesting stuff. SRH have gone for the review for LBW. Leg-break straightening and the sweep takes the glove on it's way! The appeal was for an LBW, but there was glove on it. It actually came off the glove, but the keeper has dropped it.

Prasidh to Saha, no run, Saha is looking very nervous, pushes a length ball straight to Uthappa at short extra-cover and set-off for a quick single. Dhawan wasn't coming this time, Saha has to turn around, put the dive and make his ground

Kuldeep Yadav to Saha, no run, appeal for LBW and Kuldeep prods his captain to go for the review. It's a fair delivery and replays suggest that there was some bat on that. Ultraedge confirms it and KKR have lost their review. This was very full and on the leg-stump line, Saha was looking to sweep and the inside edge perhaps saved him

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run, googly from Rashid Khan, Rayudu reads off the surface and plays off the back foot, gets hit on the pad first before the ball touched the bat, but Rayudu was well outside the line of off stump, review wasted

Jadeja to Parthiv Patel, no run, a flat in-turner and Parthiv Patel missed the glance. Legal ball and no bat involved. HawkEye shows it to be going over leg. So, Chennai lose their review! The height was always a factor as it struck Parthiv on the front leg above the knee-roll

Jadeja to Parthiv Patel, no run, a flat in-turner and Parthiv Patel missed the glance. Legal ball and no bat involved. HawkEye shows it to be going over leg. So, Chennai lose their review! The height was always a factor as it struck Parthiv on the front leg above the knee-roll

Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, no run, Hyderabad review: Not an obvious googly - yup, it's the leggie, but the obvious missed slog-sweep. And Rana's struck on his back thigh pad in front of leg. Many questions here - where's it pitching? Where's it heading? Again, like it was in the first innings, it's taking ages to load the replays for the third umpire. Poor internet speed somewhere in Kolkata, check the fiber cables .. anyway, the front foot is cleared out. Oh and the impact is just down leg

Chawla to Warner, no run, KKR review: They have decided to challenge the umpire's call against Warner. But for me, it's clearly pitching outside leg. Was the googly that beat the batsman's flick and struck him on the pads. Might have crashed into the stumps but if it's pitching outside leg, it makes no sense. Awful review by KKR. Not out is the final verdict

Prasidh to Shankar, no run, Shankar has been given OUT LBW and he wants a review. Was the ball tailing enough to miss the leg-stump? It's a fair delivery, think there's no bat on that and I feel it's sliding down - the impact seems to be in front of leg. UltraEdge confirms that there's no bat on that. Hawk-Eye in: Missing and Shankar survives. Low full-toss and the late tail beat Shankar's attempted whip, struck him low and was going down with the angle

Chawla to Bairstow, no run, SRH review: Bairstow has been adjudged lbw and he's decided to challenge the umpire's call. Is there an inside edge? There certainly is a sound. Yup, there's a spike on the UltraEdge and Jonny survives. Was the googly that beat the batsman's flick and struck him on the pads

Shami to Narine, no run, dropped! Shami has put down a tough return catch. A back of a length delivery on the stumps and Narine wanted to slap it straight down the ground. Doesn't get the required elevation and it went to the bowler at a catchable height. Shami went with both hands in his followthrough, but the ball didn't stick

Chawla to Miller, no run, this is a very wide short ball, Miller tried to fetch the pull shot, missed, the ball sneaked under the under edge, Karthik was confident in his appeal, given out and Miller overturned the call by reviewing
Bumrah to de Grandhomme, no run, clipped to the left of mid-wicket and they think of a quick single, Suryakumar Yadav was quick to gather the ball and he missed the direct hit at the batting end

Markande to de Villiers, no run, Yuvraj Singh, what have you done?. He's dropped de Villiers first ball. Flatter delivery outside off stump, de Villiers was looking to punch off the back foot, gets a thick edge that travels, Yuvi moved to his right and the ball came to the left and hit the knee

Lamichhane to Nikhil Naik, no run, Delhi have taken a review in the second over of the match itself. They've challenged the umpire's call. Has Nikhil Naik edged this? Rishabh Pant was excited but there's clear daylight between the bat and ball. Delhi lose their review! Was a quicker legbreak outside off and the batsman was looking to steer it to third man before he got beaten on his bottom edge

Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, no run, leading edge lands short of Bhuvi at point. And there's some confusion in the running but Barman gets back in safely at the non-striker's end. Lures Grandhomme into playing an across-the-line-heave, loses shape as the ball sharply turns away and it drops a couple of inches in front of SRH's captain

Unadkat to Raina, no run, a direct hit there would have been curtains for Raina. The southpaw shuffled across and tucked this length ball to short fine and set off for a quick single. Dhoni wasn't interested and sent him back. Kulkarni had all three stumps to aim, but missed the target at the striker's end

D Kulkarni to Watson, no run, Watson reviews, and then stands in disbelief that it has to come down to this. It's a leg-line, and Buttler was probably appealing for the strangle down leg only to avoid this from being given a wide. But the umpire - Nandan - is fooled. It's clearly off the thigh pad, and the bat's not even close. Overturn

Stokes to Stoinis, no run, pacy short ball from Stokes and Stoinis is a bit surprised by that, he is late on the pull/hook and the ball flies over the top-edge. Buttler went up but Stokes gestured he didn't hear anything

Dwayne Bravo to Krunal Pandya, no run, in the air and dropped! Mohit Sharma is the culprit. Krunal wanted to clear mid-off, fails to do so and ends up hitting it straight to Mohit at mid-off. It was hit hard and Mohit fails to get his fingers in the right position to grab it

SN Thakur to Krunal Pandya, no run, Review time: Krunal Pandya has been given out lbw. And he has taken the review. I don't reckon there is an inside edge on it. UltraEdge will confirm it. And there is a spike on UltraEdge. Just a tiny bit but that will be enough to save Krunal. Rod Tucker will have to change his decision. It nips back in off the deck, Krunal Pandya wanted to heave it to the on-side, plays it down the wrong line and it raps him on the pads. It looked plumb to the naked eye but an inside edge saves Krunal

Nabi to Rahul Tewatia, no run, close call! But umpire Anantha Padmanabhan is a happy man. The slider which skids on and pings Tewatia on the front pad before deflecting onto the back, he played for the turn when there wasn't any. Ball-tracking showed it to be clipping leg-stump

Rashid Khan to Chris Morris, no run, that did not look close. Not sure what made Rashid go for the review. The leg-break and Morris misses the sweep, the ball misses the front pad and strikes the back thigh, impact was always one of the issues and the turn took it past off-stump

Axar to Bairstow, no run, dropped! Axar has landed badly it seems. Was a fairly straightforward chance though and he spilled it. Bairstow used his feet for the lofted hit and ended up stroking it straight back at Axar who reacted quickly, had two bites at the cherry but couldn't cling on. Would have been a massive wicket for DC

Rahul Tewatia to Hooda, no run, dropped -- Shreyas Iyer of all people -- and it just doesn't get simpler. Hooda drives uppishly, hard, finds extra cover, where Iyer reverse cups, and is a little too casual

Lamichhane to Warner, no run, review wasted! Shockingly poor review! Iyer didn't do the right thing by agreeing to an emotional Lamichhane. This pinned Warner on the pad after missing the sweep. Always seemed to pitch outside leg but the leggie somehow convinced his skipper, despite a rejection from Pant. Result is, pitched outside leg and review gone in the drain. Poor, poor stuff

Chahal to Karthik, no run, good review in the end by DK. Got flummoxed by the fastish leg break, got pinged on the back pad as well with the turn and fizz doing him in. The umpire was late in raising his finger and Karthik chose to go for the review, almost out of hope. He probably was banking on the turn to save him and that's precisely what happens. HawkEye shows to be going over the stumps

Sam Curran to Watson, no run, smashed hard .. and flush into Curran's collar bone. Watson holds nothing back here, forehards a slap down the ground, where Curran tries his desperate best to get his hands in the way, or even save his face. Is hammered into his chest

Bhuvneshwar to Rohit, no run, angles the ball in, the ball strikes the inside edge and thuds into the pad. The bowler, keeper and almost the entire squad miss the inside edge and take a review. The UltraEdge makes it clear. Rohit survives

Tahir to A Russell, no run, oh dear, Bhajji makes a mess of this skier. Stunned faces in the crowd, they can't believe it. Uff! This is a costly miss, can't give a lifeline to someone like Russell. What have you done Bhajji? Phew. Slower and tempted Russell, who clears his front leg and aims a biggie across the line, totally miscue and sends it into the night sky. Bhajji at mid-wicket steadies himself, it was swirling in the air for a long time and he makes a meal of it. So much so that he doesn't even get a hand on it as it lobs behind him. He sort of lost his balance and slipped over

Tahir to A Russell, no run, lands the leggie on leg-stump, Russell's head was falling away as he was looking to flick. It grips and turns past his blade to knock him on the pad. Tahir went up straightaway but umpire Chettithody Shamshuddin was spot on with his call as the ball was spinning too much and eventually missed the off-stump by a few inches

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, what happened there? Miller has spilled this one. Ill-timed jump and he manages to grab a left hand to it and the ball doesn't stick. He leapt up too early and in the end only had to go with a left-hand. Suryakumar Yadav gets a life here

Jofra Archer to Dhoni, no run, huge shout of "no" from Dhoni, but that came only after he took a couple of steps down which set Rayudu on the charge. Rayudu had made it almost halfway down before having to turn back. Back of a length just outside off, patted to backward point. Rayudu changed direction while running and had the throw hit him, or even with a direct-hit, he was gone

Jofra Archer to Kedar Jadhav, no run, Steve Smith thinks Kedar Jadhav has got an outside edge to it. And Rahane has showed trust in the Australian, he has gone for a review. Kedar Jadhav has missed it by a country mile. And I have no clue what Smith heard there. It proved to be a horrible decision as there was a huge gap between the bat and the pad. It was a good length delivery wide of off and it beats the outside edge of Kedar Jadhav

Santner to Stokes, no run, was there an edge on that? Yes, but it was too fast - even for someone like MSD - pushed through flatter and quicker of off, stayed a tad low as well - Stokes was back on the punch, gets a toe-end that rolls off MSD's pads
Santner to R Tripathi, no run, turns away tantalizingly beating to the outside edge. Replays show that there was an outside edge and MS dropped it

Prasidh to Dhawan, no run, KKR review! Has Dhawan nicked it? Or did it come off the jersey? There was a certain sound but don't think it came off the willow. Or is it the trouser? Waiting for the replays. There's a spike on UltraEdge but not sure whether it's the inside edge or off the trousers. A tough call for the third umpire. No conclusive evidence and the onfield decision stays. KKR have lost their only review. A short delivery that was angled into the batsman, Dhawan was looking to block it as the ball brushed his trouser and settled into the keeper's gloves

Behrendorff to Rahane, no run, good review in the end from Rahane! Fell across a bit on the flick and missed the indipper to get pinged on the front pad. The umpire didn't waste any time in raising his finger for the LBW but Rahane wanted to review it. Height was the only thing that could have bailed him out and even that didn't look likely in real time. However, the nature of the Wankhede surface aids Jinks in the end as HawkEye shows it to be going over the sticks

Gurney to Raina, no run, the inside edge saved the southpaw. Length delivery angling in, Raina hopped back to defend and missed it. But there was an inside edge and that helped him overturn the umpire's decision which was out

Rashid Khan to Chris Morris, no run, Bairstow puts down a catch! Was a googly outside off and Morris got an outside edge as he tried to punch off the back foot. The keeper shows some generosity by not holding on to the catch

Mishra to Bhui, no run, loopy ball and slammed down the ground for the man at long-off to drop it. That was a poor drop from Munro coming in from long-off. Warner at the other end is furious as Bhui didn't even stay alert to take a single. The young man is under the pump here

Mishra to Warner, no run, and Mishra ji has dropped a tough one! That was muscled back to the bowler. Quicker one outside off and was spanked back to the bowler who got both hands to it before dropping it

U Yadav to de Kock, no run, length delivery and has been pushed back to the bowler. Umesh went for the throw after picking the ball up and misses. Had he hit, QDK wasn't even trying to get back. The batter had chipped out to push it back to the bowler

Rahul Chahar to de Villiers, no run, was it a chance for de Kock? He's having a off-day behind the stumps today. Well, looks like there wasn't any edge there. So, won't go down as a drop. It was tossed up luringly outside off, de Villiers wanted to have a piece of it as he threw his bat without any feet movement but the ball straightened and beats his outside edge

Bumrah to de Villiers, no run, Parthiv Patel was in some trouble here but puts in a dive as the throw at the bowler's end misses. Might have been 50-50 if it hit. Shortish delivery that struck de Villiers on the thigh pad as he got cramped on the flick

Rahul Chahar to Moeen Ali, no run, was there an edge? QDK can't collect it cleanly and yes, there was a definite bottom-edge there. Googly from Chahar, dropped short and it was spinning away from Ali. He went for the pull a tad early and feeds a tiny edge but QDK messes it behind, grassing it onto the floor

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run, ripper from Rashid, absolute ripper. So good was the ball, that they feel compelled to go for a review after Rayudu is beaten on the outside edge. He's missed this by inches. Only clipped the trouser on the way through. Oh well, SRH have retained their review because ball-tracking shows it to be umpire's call on off stump. I'm sure they weren't appealing for leg-before there

Chahal to Uthappa, no run, run-out chance missed! Uthappa is struggling out in the middle. The required run rate is out of their reach now! He was trying to flick the slider but got struck on his pads. Rana wanted a single but the striker wasn't up for it. Nitish was almost halfway down the track and had Chahal collected the throw from Parthiv, it would have been curtains for him

Narine to Kohli, no run, KKR's LBW review. Narine gets this to rip in big, beats Kohli's flick and finds his front pad. Now, it's struck him in front of leg, it's hit the knee roll as well in a massive stride. But it's not needed much convincing for the bowler or DK to take it up. In fact it's missed the leg-stump by another cool two stumps

Steyn to Kedar Jadhav, no run, inswinger on a length around leg-stump, Jadhav looks to get some tickle on that but fails to make any contact off the bat. It brushes the thigh pad and flies to PP to his left, Kohli checked with his bowler and keeper and then went up for the review
Dwayne Bravo to Moeen Ali, no run, that was full, wide, Moeen Ali threw his bat it and misses. There was a noise, MS went for the DRS but there was nothing on the UltraEdge. Mo continues..

Axar to Rahane, no run, Ishant spills a sitter! Embarrassing stuff from DC's senior man. Rahane shuffled well across for the sweep and skewed it aerially to short fine leg. Straightforward take but Ishant spills it. How costly will this be?

Shami to Kohli, no run, dropped! Hardus Viljeon is the fielder. Full and swinging into the pads, Kohli unleashes his whippy wrists and sends a dolly of a catch to mid-wicket where Viljeon makes an absolute Bisi Bele Bath (dal rice) out of it. Oh dear!
Narine to Smith, no run, Smith went for an across the line shot, and he was hit on the pads. He just managed to get an inside edge to it and that saved him there. An excellent over from Narine

Narine to Riyan Parag, no run, Narine drops an absolute dolly. You can't expect an easier catch than this. And he has no one else to blame. It spins back into Riyan Parag who chips it straight back to Narine. But he wasn't expecting it at all and ends up spilling it

Rashid Khan to Livingstone, no run, Very fancy shot to attempt off someone like Rashid who fizzes the ball through. But the impact is probably just outside off which has saved him. SRH aren't convinced with the umpire's call, so they go for a review. Only to waste it. Flat leg-break just outside off, Livingstone wanted to scoop it over the keeper's head, but wasn't able to connect

Malinga to Chris Lynn, no run, Pollard drops it! It was an off-cutter on a back of a length, Chris Lynn wanted to clear mid-off but he mistimed it badly. Pollard at mid-off dives dramatically to his right but fails to time his dive to perfection and ends up spilling it

Basil Thampi to Hardik Pandya, no run, fuller length delivery swerving down leg, Hardik shuffled a bit in a bid to flick it fine but couldn't make any contact. It skims the outer half of the pad en route to the keeper

Basil Thampi to Gurkeerat Singh, no run, SRH have gone for a review for a caught behind. There is surely gap between the bat and the pad. And I will be very surprised, if something comes up in UltraEdge. There is nothing on UltraEdge. And SRH will lose their review too. It was a brilliant delivery nevertheless, it was on a good length and it snaked back in after hitting the deck. Gurkeerat Singh played it down the wrong line and it went between his bat and pad. Manish Pandey strangely heard something and he was the one who pushes Williamson to go for the review!

Tye to Raina, no run, a dipping slower delivery from Tye, Raina didn't pick it as he misses the flick and overbalances a touch. Tye was confident enough to convince his skipper to go for the review but it was confirmed by UltraEdge that there was a clear inside edge
Dwayne Bravo to Pooran, no run, dropped by the substitute, Vijay! A wide and full one, Pooran gets forward and lashes it square, straight to Vijay at point where Vijay spills a rgulation chance

Boult to Saha, no run, excellent use of technology and Saha survives! Height was the factor that could have saved him but in the end, inside edge does. Was a lovely nipbacker from Boult that pinged Saha on the back pad. Didn't look dead plumb but the umpire was impressed and raised his finger. After a chat with Guptill, Saha opted for the DRS and it has saved him in the end

Mishra to Williamson, no run, a chance and Pant has dropped it, that was a regulation catch and Pant didn't go down with the ball - stood tall and fluffed it - the leg-break and Williamson pushed at it, straight in and out of Pant's gloves
Jadeja to Boult, no run, flat and fast on off-stump, Boult forces it straight back at Jaddu who couldn't cling onto a return catch

Rahul Chahar to Watson, no run, oh is that a dropped chance? Yes it was. It's the set Watto. Full delivery on the stumps, Watson drives hard and hits it back at the bowler, who doesn't accept the offer

McClenaghan to Raina, no run, Raina given out on the field, but he's reviewed it. He got into a terrible position against a cracking bouncer from McClenaghan, just left his hands up there, and according to umpire Gould it brushed his glove on the way. But there's nothing on Ultra-Edge. However, the third umpire still goes through to check if there's any visible deflection. That's interesting. Still, he can't find much to uphold the onfield call. So the decision will have to be overturned

Harbhajan to Ishan Kishan, no run, just short of Raina at cover, dropped short and wide of off, Kishan made room for the punch and didn't bother to keep it down, almost carried to cover as raina tumbled forward

Bumrah to Dhoni, no run, Dhoni reviews a caught behind: You'd think when he reviews from behind the stumps, he'd know when he hasn't nicked it. It was the typical strategy -- short, incoming bouncer, which MS pulls and apparently gloves away to the keeper. Nope, clear daylight between glove and ball, and more daylight between bat and ball. But there was a noise, which probably was his clicking bat

Chawla to Saurabh Tiwary, no run, CSK review for LBW, but looks like it was missing off stump, or maximum shaving off stump. Umpire's call will do for the batsman. Was the googly, so tough to be out LBW from over the wicket, oh yes, ball-tracker says missing off stump. Tiwary went for the big sweep and missed

Chahal to Manish Pandey, no run, the keeper got excited as soon as he caught the ball and that induced a review from Kohli. Big legbreak from Chahal and Pandey looked to flay it flat on the off-side, misses it by a whisker and there was a slightest bit of deviation after pitching which got RCB excited

Tom Curran to du Plessis, no run, that's an inch-perfect yorker, dug-out from between his legs away to short fine leg - Faf is down, gets up and tries to run across, but there's a shy at the striker's end. Would've been out if it had hit...

Shami to Finch, no run, Is Finch gone? The umpire has given him out caught behind. But Finch was quick to review it. That nipped in, Finch pushed at it and seems to have missed it. Mostly it went off the pads and into the keeper's gloves. Not out is the verdict and Finch is safe. Even he was safe on the LBW call as it was missing the wickets

Nortje to Watson, no run, dropped. Pops out of Shaw's hands at square leg like a bar of soap. He got a lifeline when he was batting and now this. Karma eh? A strong wristy whip from Watson, hitting it on the up and straight to Shaw, who couldn't lock his hands in time and grasses it. Watson will breathe easy.. you can't drop these catches at this level

Cummins to Bairstow, no run, fullish just outside off, Bairstow sits low outside off looking to scoop it over short fine leg. Loses his balance and it flies off the pad to short third man. DK calls for it and grabs. Appeals and the finger went up. Bairstow knew he didn't hit it, so got it overturned
Chakravarthy to W Saha, no run, it was the slider, Saha stayed back and didn't pick it. Played it outside the line, gets trapped on the back leg. Oh, it was the googly in fact.. close shave for Saha

Boult to Finch, no run, chance and Rohit has dropped it - fair to say, he has saved four runs - short and just outside off, Finch rocked back and drilled the pull, to the left of mid-wicket. Rohit moved across quickly, got both hands on the ball, but can't hold on

Shami to Pollard, no run, Pollard reviews! He was adjudged lbw here by the umpire, but he has straight away signaled for a review. Think there was some bat on it, as I look at the replays. Was a low full toss on leg that Pollard failed to middle. Luckily for him there was some bat on it. So the onfield decision has to be overturned. The original decision was out, hence although he got some bat on it, it will be called as a dead ball

Shami to Rohit, no run, Mumbai review this given LBW: Full, straightening back in off the pitch, and Rohit's trapped on the front pad in his crease. But, but, the impact's in front of leg-stump, and ball-tracking shows it to be going down leg. False alarm, and Rohit will stay there

Udana to Jofra Archer, no run, chance of a run-out, but Udana has made a mess of it. Tewatia was almost at the striker's end when Archer asked him to go back. But, Udana couldn't get rid of the ball quickly. Had he gone for a direct-hit at the bowler's end, Tewatia could have been in trouble. The throw wasn't an impressive one, as he parried it away towards the fielder who was charging in from mid-off. Was delivered on the pads as Jofra Archer failed to connect his flick

Russell to Hetmyer, no run, this is excellent stuff from Russell. Another short ball that is banged into the surface, he slants it across the left hander and Hetmyer cannot connect with the pull, the ball flies under his bat

Rabada to R Tripathi, no run, Tripathi reviews a caught behind: It's a nasty bouncer, head-high, over the pull and with a clear sound as it goes through to the keeper. It's the sound of the ball brushing the helmet. Okay, Tripathi will survive ..

Mishra to Nitish Rana, no run, dropped! It was a return catch and Mishra has spilt it. Flighted around off, Rana leans forward and closes the bat face to work it into the leg-side, the leading edge pops to the right of the bowler, Mishra dives across and gets both hands, but the ball does not stick. He has also hurt his finger in the process..

Sandeep Sharma to Hardik Pandya, no run, a loud shout for LBW and SRH will review. The angle means this ball must have pitched outside leg. Think so, can see all the three stumps, no bat for sure and UltraEdge confirms it. But it has pitched marginally outside leg and SRH lose their review. Good delivery to complete the spell, the slower dipping yorker from round the wicket, Hardik was looking to shovel it over the leg-side and is done by the late dip, struck low and in front of the leg-stump

Rabada to Finch, no run, Rabada drops it! Such an easy caught and bowled chance, but KG has put it down. Finch had chipped it right back to the bowler who got his palms to it, but nothing more. Maybe, he got deceived due to the trajectory as the ball was dipping on him

Nortje to de Villiers, no run, a direct-hit at the bowler's end and Kohli was gone! This was driven to Ashwin at mid-on by de Villiers and Kohli was almost halfway down the track. Ash had plenty of time to aim and go for the direct-hit at the bowler's end, but he couldn't pull it off
